review: I really can't give it lower than that because it's where I meet with friends that lives out this way and for the most part, I leave pretty happy.   I usually like to sit at the bar. But it's hard to have dinner there because once the food gets delivered, and the bartenders are busy making drinks for the other patrons,  they don't come around again and you can't get  ketchups, ranch, another settings, napkins, h2o, etc.  Drinks are pretty strong, thumbs up! Spinach dip is my usual.  I had the spareribs and shrimp - too dry.   I recommend drinks and appetizers.

I have been going to this Fridays for a long time I had learned my lesson to not eat there. I do not know what it is but every time I have a real meal there and not just appetizers my stomach churns all night. I go here to visit the bar with friends as a easy and close food and drink place. My advice visit for the happy hour, sit in the bar area and if you must have food grab a basket of fries or the fried string beans but not much more is really worth it.

Quick, short, and sweet review for all these chained establishments... Who have not heard of TGI Fridays?   I don't typically go to TGIF but since Souplantation was closed for some reason we've decided to eat here instead.... Deals:  GREAT!  (2 for $20) deal comes with one sharing appetizer, 2 entrees, and one sharing dessert.  It's quite a bit of food for the price nowadays! Food:  Meh...  It' just regular food so you don't go starving to death and it's nothing to hammer home about... Here is what we had... -- Fried Green Beans :  Not much flavor to the batter... just literally fried string beans -- porkchop... quite salty in my opinion... I'd probably do it next time without the sauce -- Petit filet... simple flavored... just a piece of meat.. -- Mash potatoes:  How come this is one dish that is usually the best in a mediocre restaurant?  Perhaps it's simply too difficult to screw it up? Service was friendly & attentive so I gotta give that to them!  Food... not so exciting... that totally reminds me why I "rarely" come to TGI Fridays... If you are in the area and looking for a great deal... give this place a shot... if you are looking for a culinary adverture for your tastebuds... I'd suggest you look it up on yelp...

This place blows! From the food, to the drinks, to the service. You're better off ordering a large bag of fries at your local fast food joint and brown bagging a 40 to some playlist on repeat in your car. Your Homegirl, Violy
Best gold medalist smoothie ever!!! And their jack Daniels chicken Alfredo is da bomb!!!!! Love the food here!!! Yummy!!!!

Fridays is a funny thing... It is pretty average in every way. Food is hit or miss, service is hit or miss, drinks are hit or miss. Here's why: Food: there are some things on the menu here that I really like- most of the appetizers, a couple of the salads are decent.  Fridays has a line of appetizers and such that are in the freezer section of the grocery store- I don't think there would be any difference (in taste) between eating  the food in a restaurant and eating it at home since it usually tastes reheated anyway. But it cures a potato skin craving rather quickly.  Service: waitstaff is usually quite friendly. They often get flustered when it's really busy and forget things, but they don't give customers attitude. I've experienced a few bartenders here though thinking they're the shit since they pour your drinks. Reality check:  this is TGI Fridays, not a high end bar or tavern.  Drinks: their mixed drinks are decent. I like the Down Home Punch. My only issue is their selection of Happy Hour beers. Nothing good. Bud and Miller and that is about it. Water is free, I'd rather get free water than spend the Happy Hour Price of $4 for something that tastes like brown water from Indiana.  All in all, I keep coming back here and I generally leave satisfied.

Table service isn't too bad, but their workers can be a little more attentive to the customers instead of flirting with each other. Service at the bar and during late night happy hour, not even close to satisfactory. They lag it a lot and they try to redeem themselves by making jokes, but you kinda just laugh out of pity.  Anyway, food is good. It's not always hot, usually just warm enough, but I do enjoy the fried green beans. I go back still because their drinks aren't too bad & the food is good, but it's nothing to rave about.
Very large bar area for seating, which is a plus when it comes time for Happy Hour.  A few TGI Fridays have skimpy bar areas but this one is roomy.

It's a TGI Friday's, it will always just be A-OK to me. Yeah, I sound like a fucking food snob and a beer snob but I don't ever come here. I just happened to come here because I was here for a get together with friends. The place was packed when I walked up to it and I was greeted instantly by the pretty girls upfront who tried to help me find my party. I also witnessed them try to help another confused member of my eventual group. So, customer service is pretty awesome here, not to mention that our group kept getting checked up on repeatedly through the night by waiters, asking for more drinks, more food..etc. I had a gin and tonic, it was not that strong and watered down pretty fast... but it was free. so. there's that. There's heat lamps outside so yes, you can wear that skimpy top tonight that makes your boobs look great but is sleeveless, because there's warmth. Yay!
Great atmosphere for an american chain restaurant , service was good , food came fast and was good and looked fresh ( not greasy ) , beer was cheap 2 .

Whaaat?! I cannot believe how low these reviews are! Maybe I get lucky every time I come here but I've had decent food and service here. Happy hour is one of the best times to come. The nacho platter is AMAZING, especially when it's at happy hour price ($5). Plenty to eat and share with others. Located in a nice shopping center so if this place gets too packed, you have so many more options close by.
Great happy hour. Great sea food. And great margaritas!.
Simply disappointed with the quality service ad well as the food! Even the drinks sucked! Tip: ....just give some to the bartender because he simply just effed up our drinks!!!

This TGI Friday's in particular gave us very bad service. They sat us on our table in a pretty decent amount of time but after that it took for ever to have somebody come to offer drinks even. Until I had to stop a waitress passing by and ask her who would be taking care of our table. After all this she helped us out herself because our waitress had gone for her lunch break!!! Hopefully it was a one time mishap but they definitely had more than enough time to have somebody notice our unattended table.

I love TGI Friday's Happy Hour and Sizzling Cheese Chicken and Shrimp plate! Both are AMAZING!!!!!  Great to watch sport games as well! :) Other than that service is not great they are rude and look annoyed! Once the waiter threw our plate on the table even though we had told her that was not what we ordered. RUDE!!!! After telling the manager she did nothing to deal with it and have had bad service if it weren't because of happy hour I probably wouldn't go back.

Love coming here for Happy Hour on my favorite day of the week: Wednesday. Its one of my favorite spots to meet my friend that lives in the area. Had appetizers & drinks. Ordered the Steak tacos.  They were pretty yummy.

I haven't written a good review in a long minute AND before they remove my cool awesome badge that I work so hard in earning I need to put my 2 cents in a few places I've been to recently THIS place being one of them. So here I go.... If you don't like what I have to say TOO DAMN BAD!! Don't bother sending me a private msg or a compliment on MY own opinion in regards to any given place. I WILL BLOCK YOU, I could care a less about ANYONE'S opinion about MY own opinion. ok now to the review.... So a few weeks ago I visited this place just because, I wanted to take my  mini me out for dinner and the only place I could think of was THIS one. Oh! it was the night of the game right before the FINAL game (the hockey game for the stanley cup) anyway this place was PACKED! I mean the whole bar area was full and I was lucky enough to get there and be seated without having to wait. The waitress was very pleasant and she smiled every time she came by our table. I had this one appetizer plate with cheese sticks, potato something with cheese, and wings. I asked for the wings to be SUPER SUPER HOT (whatever this place considers hot) anyway I didn't burn my lips and my tongue didn't get numb BUT I did enjoy my food :) of course I devoured the entire thing by myself NO PROBLEM and honestly speaking the wings had a really good kick to them! Now for the major PLUS points: my mini me fell in love with this place. I don't know exactly what or why, I mean she did finish her chicken fingers and her fries which doesn't always happen; but still she really really became a fan. This particular visit went well. SECOND visit: Service was EXCELLENT although the wings weren't half as good as the time before and the clam chowder soup taste like shiiiet, they did change it for us for the broccoli and cheese type soup which turned out to be really tasty. I have nothing bad to say about my experiences here, and even the bathrooms are clean which is always a good thing. I don't give it a 4 star because I'm not a fan, but who knows maybe they will WOW me next time and I will bump them up a star. FYI they have really good coupons for the "stripe" members :)

Service: Not all that bad. They didn't check up on us as often as I would have hoped, but they were busy. Food: It's TGI Friday, I wasn't expecting anything to stun me and I didn't get that. Drinks: The drinks weren't bad at all. Tasty and the alcohol was very generously used. All in all, its another chain in the valley that isn't all that bad to grab some grub with friends.

Don't order the chicken piccata pasta... ..it was overly oily and sour.  The best part of my meal was the fountain drink (though nothing special, it really hit the spot). It was my first time at this location.  I hadn't been to a TGIF in over 7 years. -the waitstaff were friendly -the menu is a good sell (with sticky pages though) -we had a BOGO coupon -the place was full of people as far as we could see But the food was terrible!  It was disappointing enough that I joked it must be the extensive drinks menu that's helping people overlook what they're eating. Also, too bad TGIF doesn't offer any starter bread.

This is actually the only T.G.I. Fridays I know in the valley and thankfully it's a good one. I been coming to this T.G.I. Fridays for years, it's amazing how times flies it's been at least 8+ years that my family and I been dining here.  Their food is always good, I can't recall ever getting a bad meal. Their breadsticks are alright but who really dines off breadsticks its all about the good stuff. Their desserts are delicious especially their Brownie Obession I believe its called its amazing.  Their customer service has it's bad days but overall everyone is really nice, friendly and attentive.  I have yet to get one of their mixed drinks so I cannot touch on that subject of their liquor (that needs to change ASAP, I need a DRINK) They're great for date night, girls night out and they can more than accomidate large parties.  Enjoy :]

Came here on a Sunday for lunch with a couple girlfriends.  Ordered my favorite pecan crusted chicken salad. Yum!  Our server Ted was excellent!  Very polite and attentive.  Food was good. Will meet here again in the future. :)

What the heck Northridge/Granada Hills/Porter Ranch area!!! Don't you have anywhere else that's open on a Sunday late at night?? Geezzz Ended up here 3 time already after my last Review...  Service is still slow...  At least I'm coming around to the menu... I have tried many things this month!  Appetizers:  Hot wings... Not good...  Jack Daniel Sampler... Very good  Loaded skillet Nachos... SOOOOOO SOOO GOOD.... Love the cheese on it, the flavors of everything is great.. Spinich Deep... Tasty..  Fries... Very good Chicken quesadilla... Cheeessy..  Food: Jack Daniels Chicken... Very very good... cooked well and great flavor..  Prime Rib Pasta... SOOOOOO Delicious...  Jack Daniels Sirloin and shrimp.... good ...  Drinks: Flirtiny... it was really good... nice amount of alcohol Ultimate Electric Lemonade.... sour, not enough alcohol Need to get dessert next time, God knows I'll be back.. there is nothing around this area =/ Only if they made the service better.. I would consider adding one more star..

Well we came in on a Sunday, sat in the bar, waited about fifteen minutes for someone to come to our table, and left when no one did. And in that time I had to go back to the front to ask for the happy hour menu which they didn't offer us.   So....bad service....

I haven't been here in awhile due to the horrible service last time, so I'm not too sure why we ended up there today. Decided to get some drinks and appetizers while we were shopping at Best Buy. Wondered over to Fridays after my husband tried to talk me outta it. Should have listened to him. Sat in the bar area and waited awhile to get some service, finally got someone over there and he was so uninterested in us. Got my iced tea and then took about 5 min for my husband to get his drink. Food took 30 min for 2 apps and a small salad. Service was VERY slow and he just didn't seem to ever come over to us, I had to ask the manager for our check. PLUS we were under the impression that the apps for half off during happy hour but not the one we Goodall I think they should inform you when you order that that certain app isn't half off...would that be so tough? Well, then he would actually have to speak to us! Just not too happy with this place and I'm sure if my hubby has anything to do with it we will not be back. Food was ok though.

i went for brunch on a thursday afternoon, and it was pretty empty. so u would think they would sit my mom and i at the best table, or atleast give us an option. but no- they sat us on a half booth (lit next to each other) and NEXT to the door where ic an hear the managers conversation with the waiters all the time.??... wtf? anyways the food took forever . no one came to ask if we needed re fills. over all i was in an out in 30 minutes. never again.

Came here for the first time to try the 20$ deal for 2 on a football day last year. So we weren't at the bar, we were at the very empty restaurant area and you'd think we'd have the better service. NOT. Food... Appetizer: spinach dip. Real Good but got food poisoning. Cheese n spinach not good on empty stomach. Stomach was hurting before entree arrived. Entree: fried shrimp n fries. I wanted fatty food. Cuz nothing else sounded appetizing. I had received 6 shrimp and a hand full of fries on a gigantic plate.  Popeyes won that shrimp dish. The damn waitress was a piece of crap. She sucked, retarded, and I got up ..went to the car and left without paying.  Horrible place

The service here made me miss the Fridays service at Woodland Hills TGIF. Thats really saying something. We had to send back the spinach dip (crustee) Took 10 minutes to be served sitting at the not so busy bar and we were carded twice in 3 minutes by two different bar tenders. Me thinks to myself "douche!" Then we order a drink off the Fridays Drink menu and the bartender is like, "OK, so a strawberry peachy whatever' And I look at my brother and girlfriend and think, "Double-Douche!"

Service here on a Saturday night? EEK! Your standard 30 minute wait, busy, I get that. Asking for a booth, accepting to wait no matter how long it takes to obtain one and still getting a table? Meh. The rude hostesses? No go. Our server who was kind as she could be made up for it. I got a drink and it had portions of the bottle's label in my drink. I don't want to drink paper. She gladly sent it back with no problems.  Our food arrived without problem. Everything was still warm. In truth, the hostesses are the reason I've rated this place a two out of five stars. Hostesses are the face of the establishment. If I'm treated with disrespect, why in the world would I want to support your business and/or return in the future?

Oh ......It comes down to management. The host is too busy sweeping. So expect to wait to be greeted. Its ongoing. Guest are greeted with tired person with broom. Why?  No bus staff. Sticky floors, tables. Grimy  menus , dry food in seat cracks. Frustrated staff. No order. Everyone looked scattered.     Sodium, I'm pretty sure all the food is basically frozen. I don't smell a cooking kitchen. I think they just warm up prepacked frozen food.  The food pictures look great on the menu . But my dish like looks like a 5 yr old plated it. The actual food looks saggy/ droopy. Not plump like the menu pics. I just don't know

i went on mxas eve and the service was more than good. it was GGRREEAAT!  i guess it was pretty empty cuz normal people celebrate xmas or something at home, so we were seated instantly. the waiter came to check on us like fifty times and refilled our drinks everytime it was more than half empty and joked around with me saying that i needed to order a real man's drink since i only got a water. i liked that dude, and i gave him a fat tip. for appetizers, the loaded skillet nacho thingy was amazing D: it was like potato chips but like actual potatoes with like bacon and white sawceee that made it taste like actual nachos.  i got the salmon lobster thing and it was pretty good. it had some yummy sawce on it. i feel like my friend's steak coulda been better, and the ribs were pretty good too. their onion rings taste wack though.. also i usually hate coleslaw at restaurants other than KFC, but my tastebuds liked tgif's coleslaw. sweet potato fries were decent. overall, good experience!

They have a pretty decent Black Bean Burger here. It's quite tasty and it's mixed with other veggies inside the patty. Note: There might be a little bit of cheese inside the patty in case you're a vegan or lactose.  TGI Friday's is like any other chain restaurant. It's over crowded, the venue isn't special, and the prices are pretty fair, the waitresses take forever to take your order and brings your check, and the food leans towards the saltier side. Of course, the guy who brought my burger carelessly placed the tray on the table, causing the top bun to slide from the top to the table. He did offer me to get a new bun, which was nice, but this is the service you'd should be expecting.
This Fridays has more of a sports theme to it as opposed to the one in Woodland Hills. They have a dj in the back! Definitely a good spot and fun atmosphere!
Food is decent but service can be bad at times especially when they get busy.

TGI Friday's food and service has really gone down hill. Was there last Saturday night, the hostess took down my wife's name wrong and luckily I've caught it or else we be wait for nothing. The food does taste hot and fresh. The quality is good as Denny's and the price is twice more. In the end, Denny's may taste even better.

Never thought of giving a review for this place since everything is pretty generic and has nothing special to offer. However last night I came here and got the 10 oz rib eye (goes well with my Paleo diet) and surprisingly it was decent. I didn't like the butter that was on top of the steak though. Steak was decent but the butter flavor was overpowering. The broccoli that came with the meal did not taste fresh. Too saugy and cold.  As for the service... Having cute waitresses doesn't make up for the so, so service.

Do yourself a HUGE favor and save yourself $50 by 1. Go to the grocery store 2. Buy a rack of ribs and Jack Daniels marinade 3. Put those ribs in a crock pot 4. Cover the ribs with Jack Daniels marinade 5. Cook in crock pot until done. Voila! You've saved yourself the misery of eating at TGI Fridays. I've given this place chance after chance, hoping that possibly I had visited on an 'off' night for business. Nope! Consider yourself lucky if you get a good waiter or waitress. Consider yourself lucky if your food comes to the table warm. Food has not once arrived to the table warm, and the wait staff take it personally no matter how nice you are about telling them the food is cold.  The atmosphere is good if you like noise and a busy environment. Happy Hour is the only time to visit TGI Friday's and make sure you sit in the bar. But be prepared for over priced, cold, crap food. Whomever is managing this place needs to be on the floor observing the quality of food and the service of the staff.

Called in an order for chicken pasta. Said it would be 10-15 min. Arrived over 20 minutes in and no one was up front. Went to the bar area waited 10 minutes and not helped, went back to the front and waited another 5 minutes, a girl came up looked busy and said someone else would be right up, 5 minute later a guy said go to the bar, I said I already waited there 10 minutes came up here and waited another 10. Went back to the bar where Sam finally helped , 25 minutes in, and never said anything, just took my money and gave me my order, no hi, no apology, nothing. And people wonder why people refuse to tip, good service deserves great tips , bad service deserves a discount or a refund.

The only good thing about my experience right now is my bottle of ShockTop. The service was horrible from the time we walked in the door. Got ignored by the hosts at the front even though no one else was standing there. Then, once we were finally seated , it took out waiter at least 10 minutes to approach our table. Needless to say, we will not be coming here again.

My friend and I did a two for $20 deal. I had the Bruschetta Chicken Pasta and she had the Dragon Fire Chicken. Both were absolutely delicious. We also got the chicken strip appetizer which was also very delicious and we also got some chips and salsa (which does not come with the $20 deal) separately and that too was yummy. We were very satisfied with our meal. I know not all TGI Friday's are the best, but this one is definitely one we'll come back to =)
( I only give 1 star [Bad]/ 3 stars [Okay]/ 5 stars [Great] )  HAPPY HOUR!!!! Mon-Sat = 10pm till Close (Bar Area) Sun = All Day (Whole Restaurant) Half off appetizers Drink specials 'Nuff Said.....

Forget the service....booo Food........so - so But the General Manager that was there at that time was awesome, his name is Joey.  After waiting for a long time for our food and with the lady server, who i thought did not want to be there, and hair on one of our  food, Joey took care of everything and made us forget about all the crappiness his staff did.  I would love to visit only to and recommend this branch only for Joey.  You rock!  And mind you these stars are for the great customer service we got from Joey.  Love the dessert menu too.

One of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. Got a dish that was supposed to be rice and garlic shrimp, it was a big glop of cheese covered mush. The shrimp were decent but not worth the 12 dollars.  Stupid waitress couldn't even let us know there was an upcharge for a pineapple flavored happy hour margarita. I told her I wanted the $5 margarita and she said they could do them flavored. So I got one. Once the bill came I noticed it was more than $5 so I complained. (I'm not too cheap to spend the extra dollar or so on a drink but at least let me know before I order it) Then when the manager came out to talk to us he asked me if I "had a question".  Uhh, did the waitress not explain what the issue was? Probably not, she probably just tried to cover her ass. The entire staff was incompetent and I'm pretty sure the manager was wasted.  After being in the restaurant business for 5 years and having worked as a host, waitress and manager; I know what it takes to give good service and it's honestly not that hard. Know the menu, be friendly, attentive and efficient.  Won't be coming here again.
I've come here many late nights with friends for beverages. The food is ok, nothing spectacular but still a nice place to hang out and socialize with a group of people.

My husband and I prefer to go to the TGI Fridays in Simi Valley.  But we came to this one because we went to Wally World (ugh!)  Although our server (Manny) was a doll, our food the meh....husband ordered clam chowder...meh..... I ordered the 6 oz. sirloin along with the tomato mozzarella salad and broccoli.  The salad and broccoli were fine (how can you go wrong with that?)  But my steak....oy!!!!  I ordered it 'medium' and it came back  too raw.  I had Manny take it back and have them cook it a bit more and there was no difference. I sent it back a third time and I know this time it was 'nuked' as it came back totally cooked through and through.  But the biggest disappointment was the fact that the meat was mostly grissle, fat, and suet.  One third of the meat was FAT!!!!  I spit my first  piece of meat into my napkin.  I got tired of trying to tell the server about the meat as he suggested after the second time to get me a new piece of meat but still brought me out the same annihilated, sad, microwaved, piece of meat.  Will not order that and will probably go to the TGI Friday's in Simi Valley from now on

Hadn't been here in about 2 years & I remembered why now. Went on a Sunday,  with two friends, it was not too busy. Sat in the bar area. Ordered a Bud Light that straight tasted like vinegar. It has something to do with them not cleaning the beer lines or using too much cleaner. Squeezed a few limes into the beer to make it drinkable, I would of asked for a different brand or a bottle, but I would of been there all day. Server never came around once our beers were finished to ask if we wanted more drinks or dessert . We finally flagged him down and got our bill. Not quite sure why this location has always been plagued with so/so service.

(TGIF)Thank goodness I'm Fat. Hey what did they do to this place. They got rid of all the cool stuff on the walls and repainted the walls a douchbag wanna be urban/hipster color.  It looks like TGIF is going through an identity crisis. Please please please don't change the food and ruin your restaurant like claim jumpers did. I'm all for reinventing yourself but your blandness is killing me like another justin beiber song. Please change back ....for Fridays sake.

The food is usually good, but beware when it's super busy (and it almost always is) .  I ordered the Jack Daniels chicken and the first piece I ate was really good.  But when I started eating the second piece it was totally under cooked.  Perfect way to ruin dinner.  I felt that they were rushing too much that they didn't care to make sure the food was properly prepared.

Had a really bad experience tonight.  We have eaten here before and never had a problem.   This time our waitress started out strong while we waited on my dad. Then when we finally placed the order the problems started...she could not tell us what kind of meat the ribs were on the sampler..we can't have Pork so it was really important.  After waiting almost 40 min to get our food and having to ask another waitress for something I wanted to add. The food showed up and it turned out the ribs were Pork ribs!!! Found out when they were served at our table. Then our waitress disappeared again. We had to track her down when we wanted something.  On top of that my meal and my fathers meal were supposed to have Rice Pilaf, but they served them with Jasmine rice and nobody told us. Apparently the manager was aware they didn't have any Pilaf also.  When we finally got the check we couldn't believe it , My wife returned her ice tea but was still being charged for it and my kids drink , which was supposed to be free was being charged as an adult size. When we brought it to their attention, it didn't get fixed and  the Mgr didn't even come out. He sent another waitress with some discount cards and an apology. We refused the cards and the Mgr still didn't come out. We even refused free desert still no Mgr. We had to "ask" for the Mgr to come to our table because all he did was take $10 off our check even though we were being overcharged by $7. This meant we got a $3 discount for the long wait (2 + hrs) the Pork at the table, wrong food on our plate and horrible service....after we spoke to the Mgr he offered to adjust the bill for the correct charges then give us 50% off. Instead he just takes 50% off the un-adjusted bill..the Mgr is clueless, no customer service...WE WILL NEVER RETURN THERE AGAIN.....even when when I told him we were not coming back he said "OK" like it no big deal to loose a family of 5 I think his name us Arturo or something like that. He was very poorly dressed for a Mgr not looking professional at all either. I am very surprised that TGIF would have a Mgr like this on a Saturday night.  To top it off he lied to us. he told us that he had the waitress in his office and was speaking to her about what happened but when we were pulling out she DROVE back in and got out of her car and walked back into the store...HMMMMM ?? On top of all that the Free Wifi was not working so my kids would not enjoy the digital books they brought to read....

First of all, our waiter was drunk when he got to our table, he could barely complete a sentence. He stumbled around, couldn't focus on us...then overcharged me for an item that was supposed to be added for a small fee, then argued about it with me when I had clearly memorized that section of the menu. Then he took off the extra cost and said "we'll it only takes off $2." Yes, that's $2 you overcharged me. Because you're drunk. He didn't want to give us our final receipt, so he had someone else bring it to us and then ignored us when we called for a manager. AND to top it all off, the manager didn't care. Asked if we had a question. Didn't offer any "I'm sorry about that." Only asked if we wanted a desert or to "stay and hang out." Worst service I've ever had.

Went there this last Friday and received some of the worst service I have ever had. First off our waiter was completely drunk and couldn't even remember our drink order. He kept stumbling all over himself and around the restaurant. I ordered a beer and after finishing my first drink our food still hadn't arrived. Our waiter took forever to come and offer refills or another drink so I had to go most of my meal without something to drink. In most restaurants a waiter will come when the food is served and ask how everything is - our waiter never did. If he had maybe I wouldn't of had to wait for another drink. During our whole stay he only came to our table three times. I understand if a place is busy it's hard to stay on top of all your tables, but if you are serving other tables in the same area and keep walking by a table and seeing empty drinks it doesn't take too much effort to ask if we want refills. When our waiter finally brought out ticket one of my friends was over charged for her meal. When we brought it to his attention he argued with her and then took the ticket and said he would look into it even though we knew it was the wrong amount. When he returned it his response was, "It's only $2 off." The amount wasn't the issue it was the ideal of being over charged and he never apologized about it. We asked him to split it three ways and told him which card went to what meal. When we received the final separate checks all three tickets were for the wrong amount and my card was charged twice! After the poor service and frustrated with the waiter we asked to speak to the manager. When he came I told her that my card was charged twice and when I tried to explain that all of the charges were incorrect he just interrupted us and didn't even apologize for the inconvenience. I even told him that overall the service was horrible and instead of apologizing he took the ticket and said he would take care of it. When he brought back the tickets after correcting it he asked if we wanted a free dessert or if we just wanted to "hang out" It didn't even seem like he cared that we had a horrible experience there and offered little to correct the issue. I don't see how the staff can wait on their tables there - there was another waiter in the same area and the whole time we were there (for about a good hour and half) he just stood by the booth next to ours and talked to his friends. I don't know how he served all his tables when he was at his friend's table most of the time. The bus boy came to clear the table while he stood near it and chatted with his friends. I've always had great experiences at TGI Friday's, and this one was no different. Our waitress was friendly and very personable. Overall, a wonderful experience. I would urge anyone who has had a bad experience here to give it a second chance, as a bad day at this location is one in a million. I know this is definitely my new lunch & dinner spot!

The service is awesome Olivia she was wonderful and talking about Byron the Mgr this guys make the best crew ever,thanks for making my new promotion the best night ever, my family really enjoy the service. The food was wonderful. Highly recommended

Nice place. Not as crowded as the other TGIF locations. Food is good and service is okay for a big chain. Nice place to hang out.

Fantastic customer service!!!! Super friendly and by far the nicest smile! Alma Tovar was my waitress and she is 100% sweet!!  Thank you TGI Friday's! My favorite dish is the sizzling chicken and shrimp!!! Yumm!!

One of the best burgers ever. I had the Philly one. Soooo delicious. Like this Friday's location. Will continue to come back.

This is my first time at TGIF and I am very disappointed. The service at the bar was very bad. Took them 20 minutes to move the plates from the pervious client. The food, especially the nachos nothing to brag about. Honestly not very impressed with TGIF at all. Don't know if I will come back.

Love going here the jack Daniels sauce that they put on the steaks is great  would recommend anyone to at least try it once steaks and ribs are so flavorful and sides we'll mash potatoes or the steak fries with garlic are so good my girl gets chicken and I'm not the greatest fan of chicken but wow it's awesome with the sauce

I have never been a fan of big chain restaurants. Coming to TGIF is yet another reason why. Yes they have great deals on food especially during happy hour but honestly the happy hour choices are not the best. I rather have something from the regular menu. But even then the quality of the food is horrible. I have been to this location twice now. The first time I had the orange chicken plate ( I forgot the real name of the plate) It was okay I got it because it was under 500 calories. The second time I had the flat bread BBQ pizza which was not that great. It was hard and flavorless. I tried the fried mozzarella and its good. BF had the buffalo chicken sandwich and it was horrible and hard to bite. The buffalo sauce was almost non existent. I have heard great things about the Jack Daniels selection so I might come back to try some of that stuff. One thing I wont complain about are the prices and service.

We go here often for the happy hour. But had our last visit a week ago. 100% of the time when we order the pretzel sticks with cheese the cheese is cold. Not just cool I mean refrigerator cold. The service like other comments here is terrible. It is a chain Resturant so don't have high expectations. The service is awful and the food is just gross. I came here to meet people twice (once my sister and another time with my husbands work friends). I didn't like thier service, they took forever to take our order. The watress took 2 orders before she took ours!! Service is very important!!

I had been given a TGIF gift card about two years ago but there isn't a TGIF where I live, I guess I should have put it in my car but it just languished in a desk drawer all of this time. I finally dusted it off and called my dad and nephew and told them we were going to lunch. We arrived when they opened and were seated and our drink orders were taken. I was leaning towards the Jack Daniel's Burger which comes with Jack Daniel's Sauce, Applewood-Smoked Bacon, and Provolone Cheese. When the server returned with our drinks I told him what I wanted and he informed us about the Monday specials and luckily for me the Jack Daniel's Burger was one of the specials. We all decide to order off the Monday Special Menu, I of course ordered the aforementioned burger with my nephew ordering the Tennessee BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich which consists Pork in Tennessee BBQ sauce, basted with Jack Daniel's sauce atop a toasted bun with pickles and Cajun-spiced fried onion strings. My father opted for the California Club which includes Mesquite-smoked turkey breast, applewood-smoked bacon, ham and Monterey Jack cheese on a toasted baguette with romaine lettuce, tomatoes, avocado and mayo. Our orders arrived and everything looked great, my burger was excellent and my father and nephew enjoyed their selections as well. When we finished our main courses my nephew and myself decided that we wanted dessert, I picked the Chocolate Peanut Butter Pie which consists of Chocolate ganache layered with peanut butter mousse in a peanut butter graham cracker crust. Topped with whipped cream and a peanut butter cup. My nephew chose the Tennessee Whiskey Cake which includes warm toffee cake topped with glazed pecans and vanilla ice cream. Served with butterscotch Jack Daniel's Whiskey sauce. We were both pleased with our dessert selections, I may have overdone it a little by including dessert but I enjoyed it all. The three of us enjoyed our lunch here and I may return if I find myself in the area again.

I received a voice mail from their manager after she read this review. She left a message saying she would get back to me and I have never heard another word. Can't say that I am surprised. About what I would expect after the obvious lack of customer service already displayed.

Always hit or miss... Today, miss. I has to order a shot of tequila for my "margarita", and sent back my Long Island. Where's my booze?!! Buffalo wings were dry and by then I was just annoyed... Maybe next time.
Great place for a late night snack.  I wish the TVs were in better locations but, it's a nice place non the less.

Only redeeming quality is the happy hour. Great prices and the drinks are decent. Service is always questionable, and the food is mediocre at best. The homes in the area are crazy expensive, and the restaurant selection is the worst!

Paige was our server in the cocktail area and set us up with trivia and was attentive with being annoying.  Overall I'm very pleased with our visit.

First, it's a cool atmosphere to watch local games since it'll fill with local people cheering for your team! Hooray! But this probably goes for every local bar/bar-themed restaurant in Los Angeles, so big whoop I guess. Second, the happy hour specials are pretty great. Cheap brews or margaritas plus half price apps. Having had a couple of the appetizers, they are not really worth full price so definitely do happy hour. Third, the service. This is probably the worst part. My most recent trip (since that is the only one I can really recall the service from) we had 2 different servers since we were in the restaurant for a long time because the game went into OT! (btw hockey overtime just makes me crazy!!) Anyway, our first server was really great, friendly, took our order and checked for refills in a timely manner, with one of the greatest smiles I've seen in the biz. I am also in an occupation where you can feel really run down, really fast, so I appreciate that this guy was--at the very least--very good at pretending he was happy to be there. When he was leaving, I made sure to close my tab so I could leave him a nice tip. Which was good, because the girl who came after left something to be desired. She wasn't really unfriendly, but she was covering us for probably close to 2 hours and I saw her...maybe twice. It was a good thing the Kings won so I didn't have to leave the restaurant feeling yucky because of this lady. TGIF's is obviously nothing you'd go out of your way for, and there's a reason.

This place is wick-wick-wack. Food takes way too long, service sucks! We have been waiting for a really long time for food and the only thing they do just saying sorry. Really??? That's not the service people want.

Tell me why the waiters just stood there when I entered the doors and didn't greet me and my partner? I had to say I needed a table. The girl at the front just stood there. I think the final straw was when she drooped our food off and just walked away, after I said thank you.  Also ordered a new strawberry salad and there was waaaay too much dressing added to it. Was not a tasteful meal.  Word of advice to this location is train your servers better. Never returning to this location again.
The food was good however the poor service ruined my whole lunch! The host had a rude attitude and I did not like the vibe of the waitress.
Horrible, long wait service . The food was overcooked, including my appetizer. Greasy over fried wedges and an over done steak made my visit less than pleasant.

This review is actually late but it still irks me. Aside from my parents having bad service and long wait time there experience wasnt as bad as my sisters who went a week after.I had bought gift cards for my parents and sister so that they can try something different. My sister took her friends went in and waited to be seated despite many empty seats available. when they finally got seated they waited 20 minutes for just water. Another 20 minutes and they were asked to move because a big party was coming in. (my sister was in a party of 3 ) they were offered free appetizers that took another 20 minutes and still no drinks. However the party of 12+had all of their drinks and appetizers! Then they were asked to move again by a completely different waitress because theirs went to break! They got up and left. Customer service here is complete crap. When we called to complain the manager offered free $15 gift certificate after being told we will no longer come here and didnt really acknowledge the issue. It was simply "ok I will give you a gift card". Not once an "Im sorry". I wanted a refund for the giftcards I had purchased not new ones, due to the fact I wasn't, nor my family and friends, were ever going back there. I'd rather eat at the In-N-Out where service at all establishments is great and where I never had a bad burger. Dont waste your time or let your patience be tested here. Its not worth it. there are many other restaurants in that shopping center, both fast food and sit down.Zero stars, there should be a negative option.

Maybe I am biased to this location alot of child hood memories and great ones at that, out of all the fridays ive been to this one is the cleanest, best steaks, great appetizers and wait times are not to long.

Wow... I love the food at this establishment BUT the service I got from a waitress named Gracie...(at least that's what she said), was horrible!! All she did was being the food. She didn't say hi.. She didn't even say "here's your food" .. Dude, with how rude she was.. if you think I'm tipping, you must think I'm stupid.

Claudia was awesome! Me, my husband and brother in-law left full and happy! Service was quick and food was delicious.  It does get busier here on weekends and obviously food won't come out as fast if you want it made right. You want "fast" food on weekends, go to a fast food restaurant, not a sit down one. This is a local spot and I have never experienced bad service, not sure where the low ratings come from. Will definitely come back in the near future.

For a party of 4 the service was quick and efficient on their part; but I know it could be very frustrating when your party is between 10-20 people a little overwhelming for the waitress here and in any. The Jack Daniels ribs with sirloin and mashed potatoes and Parmesan steak fries was delicious!! The ribs finger licking.

Avoid this place like the plague. The servers are not very big on customer service but they are big on sarcastic condescending responses INCLUDING THE MANAGER.  I order a drink from the menu I get a different drink bought to me. I tell the server it's wrong and she insists it's what I ordered.... Even when I pointed it out on the menu that I wanted the blood orange sangria. She then tells me the menu is wrong. I order something else another sangria they got that right.  Dinner.... I order a lettuce wrapped stacked philly burger I get two patties slapped together a slide of Swiss tomato and two pickle slices on a little piece of lettuce.  I tell the server it wasn't what I ordered and she states it is what I ordered I said most items are missing and she says it's in between the patties and she can't touch my food but it's there. so I then take apart the two patties to nothing. Hmmm ok so 3/4 of the toppings are not on it, no mushrooms no philly style beef, no grilled onions, no horseradish sauce, etc.  The rest of my family never got refills on drinks, throughout the dining experience.  Manager you pissed me off the most when you came along to ask How things are going after I got my replacement burger I asked him to just to clarify I wasn't crazy and I ordered my sangria off the menu and he said it's been on the menu for a while and I'm probably the 2nd person to ever order it.... I find that hard to believe buddy.  Let's train management to then better train the staff on how to put the attitudes aside.  Don't question me just fix it. Menu is deceiving with all the pictures. Don't waste your time or money here.

Came here on a Friday night and through the hustle of the evening we were still served promptly. I didn't experience any of the incidences that the other reviewers talked about. My server Claudia was wonderful and she constantly checked on us and asked us if we needed anything else. She also constantly refilled our drinks before they ever even went half empty. I couldn't have asked for better service that evening and am thankful for our waitresses help!
Slow service tonight. Our bartender/server was also eating behind the bar. Yuck. #BarRescue where you at? Can't complain about the late night happy hour though!

Well I must say I'm a little disappointed. I'm familiar with this restaurant and haven't had any overly bad experiences until tonight. I want to mention as a former server 99% of the time you have to be really rude in order for me to leave a poor tip. Not only did it take almost 20 minutes to be greeted we waited another almost 15 minutes for our drinks to come & weren't offered water. While ordering my margarita she asked "blended or on the rocks" before choosing I asked "well what are the flavors" she looked at me and responded rudely "it's not a flavor it's how it's made" YES I KNOW! (I'm asking you for the flavors so I can decide how I want it) that was the first comment, and it was rude in my opinion. Then her service was poor throughout the night. It wasn't that busy in the bar & drinks took really long. Now I understand sometimes the bar tenders take long making the drinks but while our Empty cups and plates sat on our table while she easily could have let us know it would have taken a moment she could have cleared them and prepared our next round. Overall even the host was rude when we arrived.  I actually feel really bad for leaving such a poor tip because with my friends I always side with the server. But in this case it wasn't deserved.  Customer service is everything in my eyes. Management really needs to work on their staff knowing how to provide good service. I'd say her name but she never mentioned it.

It was a pleasant surprise tonight. The food and the service were really good. The bleu cheese burger was delicious. The fries aren't so good - kind of plain. But I had the fried green beans with wasabi dipping sauce, which was really good. The potstickers were good too.

I am not a fan of chain restaurants to be honest. I am more of a hole in the wall kind of girl.  My friend wanted to have lunch her so of course i went because its about the company at that point. The food was mediocre as I expected and the serve was sub-par.  I had a yummy drink tho, so their bartender was on point at least and i got to keep the mason jar in came in cool.  BTW?!  am I the only person that gets dizzy with all the stripes everywhere hahaha
The bar is great, it's been remodeled since the last time I was here. Highly recommend it for happy hour. Staff is friendly and courteous.

So we came Here Saturday night wait was long in the bar.  We were at out table for about 15 minutes before anyone approached us. We asked bartender for a drink and she aid she had to wait for our waitress. She was extremely rude. Waitress finally came up to see what we wanted to order. She had no customer service skills. Seem as if they were all mad because they had to work on a Saturday night.  Not cool  will not be confused back to this location.

I really tried liking Friday's, considering I live down the block. For many years Friday's has been my go to restaurant. I've tried almost everything on the menu, both food and liquor.  I remember a time that once can just suggest " we meet at Friday's." Gone are those days when this place would be packed and everyone would be sitting outside on the benches waiting to be called.  The food portions have significantly decreased! I remember when the nachos had actual cheese on it, now it's a cheese sauce. The prices have also gone down. Friday's has made many attempts to bring customers in, from Stripe members getting a free order of chips and salsa to endless apps for 10 bucks. Guess what? It's not working! I don't have an MBA, but all I know is that customer service is key!  Today we didn't finish our meals and asked to get our check ASAP. There were flies and bugs flying around our food. I didn't know we were in the swamps. The manager came and apologized explaining that they were going to have PEST control come in tonight, 9/16/2014. He just apologized. Thanks, but that didn't help the fact that I packed my food and saw another fly buzzing around my to go box. At this point I felt compelled to toss it. Lord knows I don't need sicknesses from this. Also, one of our utensils were filthy. Please double check before you wrap it up in a napkin! I worked in the food industry too and knew better than to wrap up dirty utensils. TOSS them to the side and keep going!

Came here once, a few years back, I ordered a steak, it was warm on the outside and still a little frozen on the inside.    Never came back til my friends said that they have happy hour.   It was decent, but I wouldn't be craving to come back here again.
It's definitely improving from when they first opened. I still miss their Italiano sandwich (a hot italian deli sandwich).

This franchise seems to have gone downhill. I ordered one of their new drinks, called the beach bum. It was one of the WORST drinks I've ever had. No alcohol :( !!! Anyway,I politely went up to the bartender with a smile and asked to have another, make it stronger please. He said "they're all made the same way. Ask your server for another." Sheesh okay, guess you don't want my money? Now the manager comes by and offers me other suggestions. He said I ordered a "promo" drink. If its a promo drink, shouldn't it be delicious and make me order more drinks plus some food?! Friday's, you guys used to have amazing drinks, I'm not paying 10$ for a juice drink. :/ my fiance and I decided to leave & go elsewhere.

Came here on a Friday afternoon, it was surprisingly not busy. My table ordered an endless appetizer (buffalo wings), Jack Daniel's ribs, and cajun chicken and shrimp pasta. The buffalo wings were great and really flavorful. I love pasta and usually I'm not a fan of pasta at chains because they typically come out dry and are usually stingy on the pasta sauces but I was pleasantly surprised with TGIF's cajun chicken and shrimp pasta. The amount of sauce was on point, super flavorful, and has a spicy kick to it. Definitely would recommend it. The Jack Daniel's ribs is probably something you should stray away from  The ribs came out dry and there was hardly any meat to them. Waitress was nice but she was NOT attentive AT ALL. My table's glasses remained empty for a really long time and wanted another round of buffalo wings. It wasn't till the manager came by checking on the tables that our drinks got refilled and we told him we wanted more wings. A few minutes later the waitress finally came to our table and asked us if we wanted the same flavored wings. The waitress only came to our table about a total of three times, once to take out orders, another time after her manager told her we wanted another plate of wings, and the final time to bring the check. I would probably return because I really enjoyed the pasta but I hope for better service during the next visit.

Horrible customer service! Waiter was rude and berely attended us and when she did she gave us her attidude. We asked for a soda a simple freaking pepsi and she responded with "can you hold on!!!" Yeah she screamed it at us. What the heck!? Man, What kind of business you guys got running here? This is unnecessary and unfair for us who pay to eat here. Never again am I returning to this dump, good job on loosing a customer.  To everyone reading STAY AWAY, UNLESS YOU DONT MIND THE HORRIBLE SERVICE !   SERIOUSLY, STAY AWAY!

First time experiencing this location,  We came perfect in time for happy hour. Everything on the menu looked great, but not worth full price so we ordered a few appetizers. The service was horrible. The dude was not personal at all, he seemed like he was just there to be there. We got our spinach dip and the chips were stale, which ruined the good taste of the dip. All the food we received was so cold, it was as if they had let it sit at the order window and forgot about it. Then decided to serve it to us cold. Which made it really unappealing. The cheese was no longer melted it was hard. We didn't eat any of our cold food, and asked for the check. Even the tab, took forever to come. The restaurant was slow so I don't understand why the service was so bad.  By far this was my worst dining experience and I wouldn't recommend anyone to come dine here.

I would give this location less stars if I could.  First time at this location, and OMG, was I disappointed.  No other Friday's has ever been this bad.  We waited 40 minutes for a table for two, after being told, it would only be 15 minutes.  The reason for the long wait, they accidently missed our name on their list, so about 4 other couples got seated first.  Worst part, was we were seated right in front of the hostess podium.  Once we got to our table, it took another 20 minutes for a waiter to come by.  He took our drink order, which was a diet coke, and two waters.  He came back 10 minutes later, to let us know that he was going on break, and another waitress was going to bring our drinks.  We finally ordered, and it took 40 minutes to get our food.  My husband ordered a hamburger with coleslaw, and endless potato skins, I ordered the endless boneless wings.  When the food arrived, it was cold.  Instead of coleslaw with the burger it came with fries.  The skins were not brought out, and we had to track down the waiter to get that to the table.  The wings should have come with two additional buffalo sauce, which I never got.  We also had to track the waiter down to bring us some silverware.  Porter Ranch Friday's had the new tablet at each table, and we played games while we waited, and then found that we were charged $1.99 for the games we played.  They added that to the bill.  Our drinks were never refilled, and every time we gave the waiter that look.. he said it wasn't him.. it was the back.. they were very busy.  He used that excuse every time we needed to get something he missed.  Never again!  TGI Fridays corporate seriously needs to get involved with this location.  Worst service ever!  I suggest you try the Canoga Park location if you can!  Much better service, even when they're busy!
Went there for the ribs and was disappointed, i had the full rack and there wasn't much in the bone and they were dry. It took a very long time to get our order out. I won't be coming here again

They charge 2$ to play with their table top video games something neither the hostess nor waiter told us. Even though I specifically asked about it when we sat down. It was a surprise charge to the bill. Something I would've have gladly paid for my 3 yr old to keep entertained. But it was a sneaky charge. Beware
TGIF never disappointed. The employees are very nice and attentive. The food is very delicious. Try their $10 unlimited appetizers. They also have the trio ribs are very yummy.
Food was good. Service was so-so. Price was a little high. The atmosphere was comfortable.

Now I'm gonna be honest, I normally hate this Friday's.   Everytime I would come I would get pretty crappy service....but I love happy hour sundays. :/ Today we went to celebrate my mom's birthday, party of 9. I was hesitant to come here but it was closer than woodland hills so we just chanced it and I'm so glad we did! I have never had such an awesome waiter, my entire family was very happy with the service. Our waiter Travis made my mom's bday very memorable and she even said it herself that he set the bar very high for other waiters/waitresses.  He was constantly on top of refilling our drinks and endless appetizers. In addition to his excellent service, he was hilarious!  He had us laughing all night. We left nearly a 30% tip and I would have left more if I had more cash on me! He definitely deserved it!   We decided to only come back on days he's working, lol.....only because i know we won't be disappointed.  If you get Travis as your waiter then you're in for a treat! He's the best!!

Wow. Disappointed.  Great place to watch sports but the Management can't handle their customers. One guy drunk off his rocker is screaming at the top of his lungs and there is no game on.  Worst management I've ever experienced. I can understand during a game but calling his staff "Hey Pancho!"... And no ones cuts him off.  Just yelling non sense... While nobody else is.. Poor leadership.  Don't bring a family. You don't want to bring kids here. It's more like a biker bar during games.

I dont normally give bad reviews however, this place is not even worth one star.. I only gave it 2 stars because of the superb waitress that waited on us, well.. not waitress but she said she was managment trainee. Very friendly and nice, so theres that.  The food however was so stale, I don't even know where to begin. The burger tasted like fish! The bread was stale and wet. It wasn't even warm. I felt like the bread was just hand picked from a bag and slapped it on the plate. The boneless chicken wings was gross too! The coating was so hard, It felt like I was bitting into a gobstopper. It was so funny because the guy that gave us our food mentioned how 'phenomenal' is when comparing it to the other chain restauraunts. EHHH! Wrong! It was the complete oposite,  the texture of the chicken had the same texture as tuna... like wtf. Breading was so hard I was literally afraid that I might break one of the brackets on my braces..  Overall I probably wouldn't go back there again, sorry to the ones who assisted us, you guys were really awesome but the food sucked! Yes service was fast but the quality of the food needs MAJOR improvement.

Waitress tells us they don't change TV's on Sunday's because they're pre-programmed. Are you kidding me? Anyway, it's like most Friday's, a bit loud and slow on a Sunday when the NFL is playing, but the shrimp my daughter ordered was ok, my triple stack Reuben left a lot to be desired. I'm normally a fan, but this location doesn't seem to handle the pressure of a Sunday crowd like you would expect.

As i entered there was no Hostess present in the front,So we waited until she came up to the front.. I started to head to the bar area,However it was way to loud in their. I used to come here and watch Sunday Football games with friends and always had a great time. After a long day at work you want to go and relax,have a drink and enjoy a good meal,It wasn't the case.I'm sitting there and I'm watching the bus boy clean the table.As he's cleaning the table,he wipes the table down and throws all the debris on the floor. So within 10 minutes the Hostess see's the debris and sweeps and cleans his miss up. I had their version of  chicken brochette pasta,Meh. The pasta had a good taste but the chicken was dry and cold. I also ordered a Ice tea with no lemon and it came with lemon,not once but twice. I like lemon,but most Restaurants don't clean the lemons on the outsides. With all the pesticides and chemicals used.Must be safe.Its just a precaution on my part. Not a good visit.

This Fridays food and service USE to be good. Not any more it all went down hill. My husband order a cheese burger with bacon asked for no tomatoes and onions and they bring him a plain burger with nothing on it. the manager brought him the plate and gave it to him like that. He asked if he can have ketchup and she hands him the ketchup bottle to him from the kitchen. What kind of manager would serve food to a customer that was not up to standers. And that's not the only thing my 5 year old daughter order a grilled cheese sandwich and the cheese was BLACK! it was burned and disgusting and can not believe they served a 5 year old child a BLACK AND BURNT grilled cheese. The manager was very rude about everything and very unprofessional! We didn't have to pay for the food and left hungry. never going back to this Fridays ever again!

Food is great but their service at the bar freakin sucks. Got to always wait to get another round. Applebee's has better service. To bad we don't have one closer to us. Can we make TGI fridays  into Applebee's. The bartender "Clayton" sucks at TGI Firdays

This is the third time I've visited this particular TGI Friday's in about 5 years.  I had been pleased with both food and service until this visit.  We arrived about 11:30, and the restaurant had perhaps 3-4 filled tables.  We promptly ordered drinks, found things to order on the menu and the service was fine.  I ordered one of the stacked burgers, mainly because it said PEPPERED BACON and I love that stuff.  Plus the cheeses and sauce (w/mushrooms) sounded great.  What I got was nothing like the lovely photo in the menu, and when I lifted up the bun, there was no sauce, no mushrooms, no crumbled bleu cheese.  Just thin melted cheese, a couple of pickle slices, lettuce and tomato and about 5 small broken up pieces of bacon - probably the same amount McDonalds puts on their bacon burger (the cheap one).  Plus, it did not appear to be peppered bacon.  So I asked the server why there was nothing on the burger - she said she told them to leave the onions out - I had told her if they were mixed in the sauce that would be fine.  I also asked if it was peppered bacon and why there wasn't much of it.  She took the burger away, and about 10 minutes later brought it out again, this time with some of the sauce it should have originally had, and the same measly amount of bacon.  This is not a cheap cheeseburger - plus I added sweet potato fries (which were pretty good) so my burger ended up being a $12 burger with about 25 cents worth of sauce and bacon.  As the place got busier, we saw less and less of the server, and I had to flag her down (over 45 min into our meal and she had not asked us if we needed refills) to get drinks.  It took another 15 min or so to get the drinks - she had forgotten until I waved at her and held up my empty cup. So much for this restaurant.  I won't be back any time in the near future since there are plenty of other places that offer more bang for my buck.

So my friend and I decided to have dinner here after some shopping we did. The host who sat us down was a young man who by the way needs to smile if his greeting people right in front of the entrance. Well we had asked to be seated at a booth since we had my friends 2 yr old son and won't stay still in a high chair. The young man response was they're people waiting for booth right now. He did not have no customer service what so ever. So he sat a man who was already sitting at a table at an empty booth. Well we asked another waitress who look clueless on what she was doing. We asked if we were able to sit at an empty booth which was still dirty cause people had just left. Her response was Im not sure. You will have to wait and your server will be the same let me ask for you. So she asked the same guy who sat us down. Although he didn't tell us personally but we over heard him tell the waitress that we couldn't sit there because people were waiting on this table. So they didn't tell us anything. The table was still empty we asked our waiter if we could sit at the booth which was still dirty by the way. He was kind enough to say sure he moved us over and cleaned the table. So we were happy about that. Everything was good till I asked our waiter for cups of water. That took forever, I had to ask a different waiter to get us water cause our waiter was nowhere to be found. When it came time to pay. They took forever to get our bill. It wasn't that busy either for being a Monday night. They need to be aware of their customers and work on their customer service.

First time here, overall food ( parmesan crusted chicken with steak fries and mozarella/tomatoes) was okay but the spinach flatbread , mozzarella sticks (sorry no pic bc too good) were very good. I gave it 4 stars instead of 3 because we were a big group about 20 and our waitress Jessica was very patient with us. Our group got a little bit louder as evening goes on as "spirits" continue to flow. Lol. Some people unfortunately had to move away from us ...sorry. Good company made experience so much better!

The All American Stacked Burger looks nothing like the picture. It is actually 2 patties which are the size of Happy Meal burgers. Each burger weighs 1/8 of a pound!   I was very disappointed considering the price tag.

If you need to read a review on TGI Fridays,  you are not a foodie and you don't get out much.  So you may be better of going to in n out next door.   Having said that as my good friend Johnny would say, the food is not great.   The service is ok and the drinks are water down but they are cheap during happy hour and that is really the only reason to go.   That and it is close to the house.
I'm sorry I was not impressed with this tgif, not to say they are all some type of way...but I will never visit that one ever again.

I am not a fan in complaining about a place but I just can't believe what happened to us. My friend and I get to tgif at 3:20 (mind you we both have no put one thing in our mouth.. We're starving!!) we get seated 20 min later no one came to our table to ask us for drinks finally a girl comes and says your waitress is busy at another table im gonna get you drinks she gets us drinks... 15 min later our waitress arrives says sorry for the wait. We order our appetizers and our entire meal. We specifically asked for it to come out at different timings 40 min of sitting at our table with no food we ask for a manager finally our food comes and guess what? All at ones. Everything was cold and nasty the manager was sweet and said she'll supposedly remake our pastas and get them after we eat our appetizers. Guess what? 10 min she comes out with the same pasta extremely cold the cheese wasn't even melted and the plate was freezing. Lol don't even remind me about the bill. I will never ever come back here again. So disgusted by the service and food was horrible. Sad because I used to always come here. Sad to see such a great place to go downhill.

was there last weekend for the new sizzling chicken dinner.. shouldnt the plate at least be hot?? it came on a protective platter but the food had obviously been done for a while since it had cooled.. not great.. hostess was good enough to remove the charge from my bill...

How dare u not want to take the reservation for my b day party. Telling me to come in at 3 pm or at 9 pm when my party is scheduled for 8 pm. Two other tgif took my reservation.  Or you told me to change my party to a way lesser amount. And then when I call back to get your corporate number you put me on hold for 20 mins. I had to change my bday plans because of you. Not happy. Well charles, general manager, you have permanently lost my business. And my large party. Apparently you don't want our money. Sad day at tgif all I have to say is thank god its not porter ranch Fridays that I'll b celebrating at.

If you go to the bar area it takes a long time to order and get your food. I think they are understaffed at the bar area and that's why they take so long. The staff are for the most part pretty friendly. They get crowded during the week for a  weekday and sometimes they have a dj which add more to the ambience.  Happy hour does not start until 10pm exactly during the week. Happy hour will get you 50% off appetizers and a discount on drinks. My drink was still pretty expensive with my happy hour $8 for a martini. It's worth it to sign up for the card perks! They are always sending me information on events and or special deals free items. Every time you go you have to let your waiter or waitress know that you have the card. You can also say your phone number and it adds more to the amount of deals you will get throughout the month. It's always great to cash your points in for some free food ranging in prices (appetizers, desserts, burgers, and so much more)!

Restaurant is clean. Customer service is ok. They need to be educated on good service. Restrooms are dirty. We had appetizers and they were ok. We order the endless appetizers & off the regular menu. Just ok experience.

Initially walking in I immediately wanted to walk out. The hostess, who didn't acknowledge us because she was to busy conversating with some people was not good at all. Domingo I think that was his name was passing by and greeted us also asked if we've been helped and thats when the hostess finally spoke to us. After being sitted everything was great. The server was amazing. The food and drinks came out extremely fast. It was delicious.I wish I has asked the servers name. Only reason im giving 3 stars is because of the host n the .50 cent refills.

Never again will I come here the waitress was awesome but the food really sucks.. I ordered the endless appetizer from all the options I only like 1 which was the flatbread BBQ chicken. The rest were yucky the boneless buffalo wings were nasty toooooo much breadcrumbs. The pot stickers they forgot to bring them to me so they send them under cooked it was doughy and nasty. The restroom omg nasty nasty nasty

The service here is consistently terrible every time I've gone here I was disappointed with the service. Not even the great app deals or the drinks (which came so slow that I had to leave my table go to the bar and ask for waters and stand and wait for the bartender to get it for me and I took back to the table for me and my friends). So now I have to drive all the way to the Canoga park location (Canoga and victory) just to be able to enjoy the dining experience. When I go out I want to be taken care of, not have to get my own drinks, not have to have each person at the table keep an eye out to flag a random waiter. I give this place 2 thumbs down. The 2 stars are for the happy hour value.
Ordered the taste and share for $24 with my best bud and all the appetizers were delicious. I've been here a couple of times and this time was one of the better ones.

Never been to a TGIF's ever, heard about the endless apps promotion they were having and decided to try it out with my cousin. Review is strictly for the endless apps. Happy hour does seem like it has good deals, might be back to try it out.  Food: So that endless apps promotion, $12 for unlimited refills of apps from a menu of 9 apps. Not sharable with the entire table but I don't know if they police it. So my cousin and I ended up doing 3 rounds. We tried the buffalo boneless wings, bbq boneless wings, potato skins, pot stickers and bbq flatbread (ordered the buffalo wings twice). Honestly the only thing worth getting are the boneless wings, though didn't try the sriracha sauce, buffalo and bbq sauce were pretty good. The potato skins were weird, they looked crispy but not really and the cheese sauce was strange looking, not a fan of it. BBQ chicken flatbread wasn't great, it was a little bland even with the bbq sauce. The pot stickers were actually pretty good, the dipping sauce for them was good but wish the pot stickers were crispier. All in all I would only recommend the boneless wings. If we could re-do it we would probably do like 5 rounds of the boneless wings. 1 star for the boneless wings (wish it was traditional wings honestly). Service: Our server was Katherine and she was great. I honestly thought they would lag it with the refills for cost control reasons but she got our refill orders quick and it came out in a timely matter. Drinks refills were quick as well. Another star for the service. Location: In the huge Porter Ranch plaza. Located around the outside perimeter next to the In N Out. I hadn't been here in years and had always thought of the place as pretty mediocre but after tonight i must say i am very impressed.  came here with a friend after receiving a coupon in the mail for buy one get on free entree. i was very surprised walking in as they had remodeled since i had last been inside. the bar area was segregated from the rest of the dining area which kept the noise level low and the atmosphere pleasant for conversation. the waitress was wonderful and attentive, very shocked at how good the service was. i really enjoyed my food as well, as did my friend. she ordered the hibachi chicken and i ordered the non jack daniels flat iron streak that cimes with parmesean butter. cooked medium rare as requested and surprisingly tender and flavorful. really enjoyed my sides and my friend commented on how the steamed broccoli was the softest broccoli she had ever had.  We both really enjoyed our meals and with the coupon we had we walked away paying under $15 each including tax, tip,entree, and a drink(non alcoholic.) it is possible we just came on a really good night so i definitely plan to return in the near future and see if it holds up. but i am actually very surprised by all the negative reviews on the food and service. i found the food and service to be much better than some places twice the price. definitely worth giving a try if you havent been here recently.

I ordered a classic cheeseburger (medium well), my boyfriend decided to go for the build your own burger (provolone cheese, two patties (after asking the waitress if he could order a second one to which she said "I'm not sure if you can do that, but if you can't I'll come back and let you know." All she had to do was charge him the difference...), guacamole, crispy onions, jalapenos (for another additional charge), and his mom ordered the flat iron steak. We waited about...15 minutes for our food. At first glance everything looked okay. My boyfriend went to pick up his burger and noticed there was a tomato on it which he's horribly allergic to, it was missing the crispy onions AND the jalapenos. The sweet potato fries were soggy and inedible. The bottom bun was so drenched in liquid it immediately fell apart when he went to pick it up, not to mention it was ice cold. He showed her what his burger looked like and was missing, and she just kind of stood there. She didn't offer to take it back, she instead had quite the comeback. "Well, I wrote it down right. They must have messed it up in the kitchen." ...Okay, see, this is where the server is supposed to offer to rectify the situation by taking the food back and getting it remade. She stood there for about 45 seconds and then said, "Well, I guess I can take it back there and have them re do it. Do you want me to have them remake it for you?" Uh, of course! He was visibly frustrated and I was quite angry with her response. About 10 minutes passed by and the second burger and new order of fries arrived. The burger was missing jalapenos. The fries were better. He didn't say anything to the waitress this time as he was pretty much over the experience we were having. He went to talk to the manager, Kyle.  Here's where I have something positive to say: Kyle comped a decent chunk of the bill which we very much appreciated. He was kind, apologetic and made sure we felt well taken care of after the bad night of sassy service and sub par food. I have nothing negative to say about him, in fact he's the only reason the experience wasn't all bad.  We paid the bill and headed home. About 45 minutes later my boyfriend and I were getting ready to leave the house to run errands when he turned to me and told me he was really nauseous. Huh. I was feeling really sick too. We asked his mom who said the same thing, she felt sick. We all ended up with food poisoning that's carried into the following morning as I write this review. We're all in agreement, we're never going back to this TGI Fridays. If I were you, I'd think twice about going there too.
