Then I ordered the chicken fingers which made me feel uneasy until I got home where I threw up my whole meal. My cousin ordered a pasta, which she wasn't very happy with either and ended up feeling uneasy when she got home. Our experience at TGIFridays was not pleasant, needless to say WE ARE NEVER RETURNING THERE!

Save your money, and stomach, and go to In N Out right across the way. At least they serve quality food and their employees pay attention to the customers! After experiencing the worst service ever from "Sonni" whom neglected to check on her tables and makes them sit around, I would never return for the lack of work ethic. I mean seriously to fail at being a half decent server takes some EXTRAORDINARY skill. The food is not up to par as well. A lot of people will order food based off the pictures they see in the menu, but at a (AIR QUOTE) legitimate (END AIR QUOTE) restaurant, you expect your food to look exactly like the picture. The only time you don't expect your food to look the picture is when you go to McDonald's drive thru. Whoever cooked my Cajun chicken & shrimp pasta definitely did not prep it like the picture looked and went way too heavy on the pepper. It felt like I was drinking straight out of the pepper shaker as each bite fell from my pharynx, scrapping through my esophagus, and finally plummeting to my stomach. After eating less than half the pasta, I couldn't take one more bite before I'd make myself sick. Yet, here I am composing this Yelp review with a still uneasy and upset stomach from last night's dinner brought to you by none other than TGI Friday's! Needless to say, the food is no good, the service is a disgrace, why don't they just close this place?!  P.S. My cousin had accompanied me and originally ordered the Chicken Caesar salad. For some unethical reason they mixed romaine lettuce with spinach and served her some other dressing besides Caesar dressing. To mess up a simple Caesar salad takes an unorthodox set of skills. She got chicken tenders after flagging down a hostess and explaining that she didn't care for the salad (because to reiterate Sonni will peer from behind the soda station's glass window to look at her tables but won't check on them, as she is too busy talking to her co-workers) and had attempted to try something else. When we got home, my cousin ended up being sicker than I and actually threw up whatever excuse of food these people dare serve to paying customers.  SO ONCE AGAIN YOU ARE BETTER OFF GOING TO IN N OUT ACROSS THE WAY! Don't waste your money here, you'll wish you could turn back time and go literally anywhere else. Avoid this location and chain at all costs.

Where do I start?  This Porter Ranch location a few years back was packed for lunch every day.  For the past year or more, it's been empty.   i decided to give it a try again as it's been about a year since the last time i ate here.  I remember thinking then that this place was off.  Food didn't taste right, service was awkward, and it was really slow. Well it all came back to me again today and it was worse.   The food was not bad.  8/10 Service was missing.  No refills on sodas, never even stopped by to see how we were doing.  Forgot to bring out a salad.  2/10 A male who I think is the manager brought the food out and appeared to be more on top of it.  He looked stressed while the waitress was clueless for the most part. i can't put my finger on it, but this place is just really poorly managed and the staff needs to get trained on customer service and service in a restaurant setting. It's weird that it's been gong on for so long and it hasn't been fixed.  I doubt they can keep this up much longer.  Friday's seems like they are about to go under.

1.5 stars... Stopped in for the endless appetizers, and we won't make that mistake again. Our happy hour turned sad rather quickly. Started out with boneless wings and loaded skins. Wings were soggy so we sent them back. Skins had nasty cheese type substance and bacon... Not ordering those again! Our replacement wings were good and the mozz sticks were also tasty. Green bean fries and potstickers were next on the agenda, and both were good. Service was horrible as they had one waitress servicing the bar and the restaurant...I also saw her cleaning up tables, so getting drinks was a hassle. Food was marginal and prices were average. Service put us over the edge, so we are done with TGIF....

I gave 4 stars because our experience was not  perfect but it was great. This was our first time to go in this branch. We came on a Friday (8/5/16) at 6pm and they were busy. I was surprised to have our table ready in less than 20 minutes. Food was good but I enjoyed the service the most. Our server Claudia was Excellent! She's not the overly chatty type but she was very attentive and came back to our table from time to time to check if we need refills or if we want the next endless appetizer. She's also not the type who would make you feel that it's time for you to go like in some restaurants (CPK, Olive Garden..). So we get to enjoy our great, relaxing dinner. I also love that they have tablet in each table where you can do your payment. I really think it's cool. It also has games where kids can play but for a fee of $1.99, just wish it will be lower. Overall, will I come back to this place? Definitely!

Must have the A crew on Sundays because we went there on Monday and the server never reached our table and sent the greeter dude who really screwed up the order.  Service was very slow and then they brought onion rings rather than fries (we were very clear on fries), placed the Jack Daniels  sauce and onion rings on the sandwich (after we said not to do it) and it was an overall bad experience. Fries were cold and obviously been in the kitchen most the afternoon.   Normally eat on Sundays and Friday nights at TGIF and the service is always good...not on Mondays. Bad experience.

I can't believe this place only has 2 stars. Maybe because it's in porter ranch and people are picky. I love coming here using the coupons we get in the mail and if your signed up for rewards that helps too. Cool place to drink, have some food and watch sports. Wish they had more tvs and of course the food could be a little better but I wouldn't even take a star for that because I can't complain. Service is usually good. Needs a little bit more credit then 2 stars!!

"Stopped at Friday's in Porter Ranch, California on Saturday, 9/10/16, at 4:42 pm. As we were being seated, I attempted to stop the hostess so we could get a booth. There was an empty booth with cutlery & napkins. She said in a rude tone, it would take 5-10 minutes. Meanwhile, a party of 4 that came in after was seated promptly. The hostess was going back & forth with me. I noticed I could visit Facebook & I asked for her name, she said I didn't need it. As she was leaving to get a manager she turned around quickly, came up to face. I asked her how long she has been doing customer service, she 2 years. I told her, unbelievable, she had the worst service i have ever encountered. Kyle, the manager finally came up & i reiterated the issue i was experiencing. Kyle asked if i requested a booth. I told Kyle this was my first & last time at this location. Kyle refused to give the hostess' name. Kyle asked if i still wanted a booth, i told him no, because I couldn't trust how my food would be prepared. This location has 2 stars, don't visit this location. "BAD". I have to give least 1 star & that's being kind!" Kyle wanted to protect his employees. We are the reason, you Kyle & the hostess has employment. Facebook is used for positive & negative feedback. Kyle, is a poor management representation. Hostess with no name needs to take a sensitive training class. Very poor service.

The last time I went here the service was HORRIBLE, and it wasn't even packed when we went. Not only did it take our server a while to come take our order, but our food took 40 minutes to come to our table and all we ordered were a few appetizers. When the food arrived the presentation of it was severely lacking, it looked like they just threw it all onto the plate, and it was also slightly warm as if it had been done for a while but they had forgotten to bring it out to us. We were all very disappointed, don't plan on coming back.

ROACH SIGHTING!! Horrible experience!  When we arrived, it took 15 mins min for a waiter to come and order our drinks. The whole time we're eating there was a FLY buzzing around our table and kept landing on us and the food. It was annoying and nasty. The waiter hardly came to the table as well. And then when we finally were able to get a hold of the waiters to get out bill, i thought i seen a big ROACH on the table. I then think maybe it was not really a roach, i only seen it for a second. And then i see it on the table again and i jump up off the seat. Luckily when i had seen it a waiter saw it, he the grabbed it with his hands and quickly ran away with it. And 10 mins later a manager comes to the table and say she will take 20% off the bill. I am at this point just feeling disgusted that this has happened AFTER i had finished my meal so i do not want to argue and i want to get out. I feel that meal should have been free. Or better, I would have preffered to pay full price and eat in a restraunt with no roaches. This place needs to deal with this problem and should not be serving food like this.

Although food was average, I would like to spotlight one of the workers that really shined on stage. The handsome, red-headed host greeted us with so much charisma, charm, and grace. After giving an wait time almost completely accurate to the minute, we were seated with dignity befitting a president or royalty. Despite the rest of the meal being just average, the first interaction with the host made everything else acceptable. Our host really epitomizes someone who believes that even one person, no matter how small of a responsibility, can make a big difference. I strongly suggest that all of you also come to get the newest, hottest dessert there--and I'm not talking about the pizooki!

Every time I do some shopping in Porter Ranch I always make a quick stop at Friday's to enjoy one of their delicious steaks. The New York Strip never disappoints, neither does the Flat Iron. The staff is very friendly and the service is exceptional. I have frequented this Friday's for a number of years and I always leave with a smile. Great food, great service.

I usually love going here. I love the ribs! Last night though, it took more than 1 hour to get our 2 orders of ribs. Hubby got mad and wanted to cancel. But I was hungry! I still love the ribs but the waiting time sucks! Just a sorry from the guy waiting on us was not enough for our wasted time.

We took my brother and his wife to TG Fridays in Porter Ranch for their anniversary last week and we're extremely disappointed in the quality of the food. The service was fine but didn't make up for the poor meal.  My wife and I both ordered the steal and lobster, my wife's meal was lukewarm to cold and mine was so poor I barely touched it. My french fries were not freshly cooked and must have been under a hot lamp for sometime and my steak had so much grizzle that it was uneatable. For some reason they took the risotto, which had been one of their better dishes off the menu. Needless to say it was a terrible dining experience.

Asked about an alternative choice for my order. Was told there was no up charge. Then they came back to tell me there was going to be an upcharge. They changed their pricing and started charging ppl even though they didn't change their menus. Pretty sure false advertising isn't okay in the retail environment. I think Kohl's is being sued for this very thing. They should update their menu pricing BEFORE rolling out another price to customers. Don't you think?

Terrible food.  It tasted like I got it at an amusement park.  I had not been to a Friday's in years.  I don't remember the food being that bad....has something changed or do I just have a more critical palate now that I am in my 40s?  Service was adequate.  One mistake but she was very nice.  She is the only reason I give this place 2 stars....barely 2 stars.  Food = yeeccchhhh.

I've been going to TGIF- I've seen the menu change- some better. Some worse. It's the jack Daniels sauce that's keeps me coming back- honestly, that's the only reason. The meat is always chewy-- and the food is always greasy.

Endless apps are great! Our server was great! The manager was great! Everything was great. Come during football games and happy hour and you will leave very happy! I was over charged for my wine, but I left happy so didn't complain!

My friends and I were brought to our table with menus on the table and "cleaned" wrapped utensils on top of a dirty table and dirty floor. Broken crayons all over the floor. Sauce on the table. The host he had to sweep the floor before we sat. The waitress was able to flag a busboy to clean up the mess and removed our "clean" utensils that was on top a sauce dirty table. She later returned with new utensils and they had the same sauce stains. The waitress brought us the same dirty utensils with sauce stains on the napkins after our table was just cleaned. This place was the best and not no more. I wish I should have taken a pic and posted on here prior to seating. Completely absurd on Christmas Day. We had enough and left. The thing I can never comprehend is why would you put new utensils and menus on top of a dirty table and leave the floor messy for the new customers??? I think the employees there should do a better job taking care of their customers and be retrained.

I'm only giving two stars for the server who was nice and helpful.  This comment is about the manager on duty.  I didn't catch his name but he was Caucasian with a beard and super unprofessional.  My friend and I came in with two coupons.  Two servers stated that we could use the coupons but as soon as we finished our meals the manager did not want to honor them.  A great deal of time was spent with this manager on three different occasions explaining that the servers stated we could get the discounts and that he should honor this.  He was inflexible and resistant to giving us a discount.  He is a poor leader and his negative attitude left a bad taste in our mouths.  Like they say it all starts at the top and this manager was just awful.
we've been coming here for about three years ever since we moved to Chatsworth.  never have we had any issues.  the severs are cheerful and friendly.  the food is great.

Arrived on Christmas Day to have dinner with friends and we were seated within 20 minutes. Got a table along the bar area and it was noisy but nothing harsh that we wouldn't enjoy our meal. Once we ordered our drinks they took our appetizer order, spinach dip and pretzels with cheese. Both actually tasted fine. I went with their table special for $14.99 that had a 6 oz sirloin steak and lobster tail. The steak was okay, the lobster tail was okay as well. Even with broccoli and Mac N Cheese nothing really stood out. Food was good, but nothing I would want to have again. Staff was good, but with a full house the staff can take its time in bringing the food or filling a drink order. Glad it was open but unfortunately with service like that I could have been better off picking up steaks and staying home.

My friend and I try to come to TGIF for happy hour at least once a week. They're appetizers and drinks are yummy! I usually order the warm pretzels w cheese dipping sauce, potstickers, or wings. For a chain restaurant the food is pretty tasty. Don't miss out on the special deals they have going when there's a football game playing!

I felt I had to make a review on this location now that I've been there several times. Each time it is different unfortunately. The front staff always friendly. However I'm never happy with the waiters. This time around we waited a looonnnnggggg time for our food! I felt like the waiter was serving bigger tables or ones he Thought he'd make more tips on before me and my boyfriend. Terrible. He was also very pushy on up selling more food items. The wait staff around there honestly do not want to work.... and constantly complaining how they want to go home. As I can hear as I'm eating. They need to upgrade their service.

Always different experiences every time I visit. Most of their food tastes like heated up frozen foods. Had the pasta once and didn't enjoy. What I do like is the jack daniels sauce I had on my burger.

We never had tgif before we have seen the restaurant from time to time so one night we decided to stop by after finishing some shopping in this area.  Well I have to tell you the 5 stars are for the great service our waitresses Soni gave us. From the beginning to the end we didn't have to ask for nothing she refill our drinks constantly and after we order the happy hour appetizers she brought us plates and Napkins.  The food was great the nachos grandes, cheese burger sliders, the shrimp cocktail was great. The only thing I wish it's that the wings had a more meat but other was the flavor of the food was great, and the service was amazing. We definitely will be coming back to see her. Thank you Soni great customer service.

Food was good but they did not have the food in their commercials available. Nearly the same menu as their add on TV only twice the price. Food was good, place was clean, staff was friendly. Was just bummed, they did not have menu items, or prices, they advertised on TV.

Came to enjoy, some endless, appetizers at  TGIF. On a rainy day.  Sadly. Had bad experience, 40 minutes waiting time. 10 to 15 minutes.  To bring the next order of appetizers, food a little oily. Waitress friendly. Prices decent.  Plenty of parking.

I had a great time here when i stopped for a lunch break, sitting at the bar with 3 different bartenders serving you in mid day mid week is not expected and is very appreciative. The lunch menu is ultra cheap i got me a burger with an appetizer for about $10  And i spoiled myself with two Cadillac margaritas  (lets just say i decide to not work for the rest of the day haha). The bad part was the appetizer i ordered, the loaded potato skins. The weren't loaded at all :( a bit of cheese and a bit of bacon bits... thats all. And they were super dry and over done... where is the chives, butter, sour cream some salsa i dont know... make the "loaded" a real thing not just a name... Recommended: the margaritas, lunch time menu Not recommend: the "not so" loaded potato skins.

Ok , On January 7th my birthday my mother my on and myself went out only a early dinner  for me because  I had a event to do. Waiter absolutely polite professional Class Act. Houses polite professional.  Now, as after ordering my food, I noticed live natural bugs flying over  out table.  Then I noticed above my self dirty and dusty light fixtures. I didn't even finish meal , I was trying to just enjoy my mother kind gesture. I called following Monday January 9th spoke to the acting or current manger. I was a sure they would look into it. A week went by , then another nothing  again.  I did get a call back and a follow  up email.  However  no further action has been taken.  Not about the money. It's the principle of thing that you're going to take care of it and there's no follow-up. Servers hostess  really good.. overall management is terrible!  This was my favorite Fridays.. not anymore! They need more training and to make sure it has a grade A that really. Fits..
I had the sirloin and salmon. It was pretty good.  But we also ordered a nachos grande which was really bad.  Tasteless. Anyway probably will not come again.
Great menu and excellent food with service to match. The food was a little slow coming out despite it not being busy, but it was otherwise a fine experience.

This Fridays always seems to be a little overcrowded and understaffed.  Which considering that you should be able to order from the numerous computers on every table really shouldn't be an issue. That being said, their Soft Pretzel appetizer with the super smoky beer cheese sauce was SO good.  Also I love the Jack Daniel's steak, it's the perfect mix of sweet and spicy.

I frequent this location often, with no trouble. Today I came as a party of 6.  The restaurant was packed and we were seated in reasonable time. We were greeted by our waiter Chris but you could tell he was overwhelmed already just by taking our drink order. We finally placed our food orders after waiting a while for our drinks. I soon then realized my nephew did not receive a straw when he received his Dr Pepper. I flagged Chris down when I finally saw him and he didn't have any so he said he would grab one. As he was busy with other tables We asked another waitress, brunette with her hair tied up in a pony tail,  if she happened to have a straw. She didn't but she did managed to grab one right away for us. However what rubbed me the wrong way was she proceed to flip off our waiter when he said thank you to her. Our whole table saw her do this which was very unprofessional and made us feel uncomfortable. Anyways back to the food: Two people had calm chowder and both said the soup was underwhelming. It was under-seasoned and had too many onions. My nephew received his meal of sliders with the two soups And salad with we found odd.  My moms steak was cooked well and she enjoyed it. I myself ordered the unlimited apps deal and still had not received my blackened pot stickers while everyone else had their food. I canceled my food order as everyone was almost done. Chris admitted the kitchen was short staffed and you could definitely tell. I ended up ordering mozzarella cheese sticks because I was starving. They ended up being on the house which I appreciated. I also ended up getting my potstickers courtesy of the manger who never stopped by our table but was making an appearance at all the tables around us. However I guess this location did not know what blackened meant as I received burnt potstickers rather then seasoned potstickers. As they were on the house I did not say anything and again appreciate everything Chris was trying to do to salvage the situation. Overall today was not the best experience but Chris did do his best to make a bad situation better.

I had dinner with a friend at this restaurant tonight and I must say it was the worst ever. The portions were so small that it was like it was pre-measured in a cup and slapped down on a plate. The chicken my friend had and the fish I had was like the size over tape cassette only big enough for a child. We were both very disappointed for the portion size and the price and would never go back to this restaurant again

We went here for a family dinner the other night. My hamburger was very good. My husband ordered a $25 steak and lobster plate. They brought him a small I mean real small piece of steak and a baby lobster tail. The tail and steak was so small and they put it on a huge plate that makes it look smaller. Lol. I think next time we will not order that. We will just at stick to the burger. :)

I ordered a salmon and caesar salad, charged me 19.75 and the portion I got was ridiculously small that I ended up hungry. My BF ordered the endless appetizers deal, took them 15 min to being the app every time. Will not visit again.
We found a piece of hair in my husbands plate, and device tonight was horrible. Waiter wasn't really on top of things and very slow.

I usually order the sesame chicken and potato wedges. Also on Sunday mornings during football season at about 10 u get 6 dollar beers. I had one too many and don't remember my uber car ride home. Anyway definitely a Steelers place. My husband and I met some cool Steelers fans here. Come here on game days lots and lots of fun!!
The service at this location is totaly non existent!  The servers are always just walking around but good luck getting any service. Will not be back....
Sat down and ordered app and dinner... 45 minutes later canceled app and waited 20 more minutes for dinner. No one ever apologized.

We ordered the small app boneless wings in spicy buffalo sauce. This was delicious, especially dipped in ranch.  We had a buy one seafood entree get one free--which apparently doesn't cover the Salmon Langostino, but they were nice enough to honor the coupon. However, the coupon didn't state that particular exclusion.  The awesome customer service is definitely appreciated.  I ordered the Norwegian Salmon with Langostino lobster with strawberry passion fruit tea and my husband ordered the steak & lobster. Strawberry passion fruit tea was bland. My husband's food was decent however when mine arrived it was luke warm/cold so I had them take it back to the kitchen.   They were understanding and accommodating. Overall, the food is decent but I prefer Chili's because the food is more flavorful.
THE CAJUN CHICKEN AND SHRIMP PASTA . Is a must eat at any TGIF's, it's so good ! Honestly my favorite ! Also nacho fries are bomb af too.

So in 56 minutes my wife  and I got 1 refill of our soda and only 2 servings of our unlimited appetizers. I would have been fine if they were busy but it was not very busy at all. The service was very slow, and very slow response rate

Food is nasty. I ordered bruschetta chicken pasta it tastes like they threw a jar of Ragu pizza sauce over some pasta gross.... I asked for Xtra salad dressing because there's like half a teaspoon on there but when she brought it back my food was already here service sucks and food sucks

Would give it no stars if I could. The boyfriend and I came to have a nice Sunday dinner out. The server was probably new because he didn't know the menu and rang in the wrong items. Sampler came out with one of the items being wrong AND a hair in it. My boyfriends food was covered in grease and his broccoli was brown. Second order came out and we STILL don't have our sampler. Talk about eating three entrees instead of an appetizer before. Horrible. Never coming back.

Poorly operated establishment, ordered endless menu, that ended after 1 serving. Manager unapologetic of the fact that they claim to have ran out of 50percent of menu items. Do not waste your time here. Manager had the audacity to say "yelping won't stop people from coming here". If I could give no stars. Poor service all around.

My first time at TGI Fridays and what a great experience it was.  I can't believe how busy it was for a weekday, impressive.  I got the unlimited loaded potato skins appetizer, which by the way you can't share... wait what?  Yea you can't share, but aren't appetizers for sharing?  Anyway that was lame.  I got their Patron Basil Berry Margarita, the spiniach and queso dip and my sister and I shared the Cajun fettuccini shrimp and chicken pasta.  My brother in law got their rack of ribs with a mashed potato. The loaded potato skins: 5 stars, delish, so crispy so yummy!!!  Patron Basil Berry Margarita: 5 stars!! Super pricey (12.50), BUT it was made with patron, HOWEVER!  I feel like I was low balled, as usually everywhere I go drinks are TOPPED, this one was missing like half an inch of margarita, so I missed out on a sip or two of the deliciousness, it was almost like a mojito.  And of course not much product in there as there were a lot of berries (a good thing) and lots of ice (normal), but again I felt it was steep.  OMG but can we move on to the Cajun Chicken and Shrimp pasta?!?!??!   5++++ stars!  Woah that was amazing.  I loved every bite I put into my mouth, so well seasoned, the shrimp was cooked to perfection as well as the chicken, great portion and I can't even describe how delicious this pasta was.  I want more!!!!   Service---5++++... We had a wonderful, wonderful outstanding server!  I cannot recall his name, but he was sooo nice, so attentive, it just seem that he loved his job and taking care of people.  I haven't had customer service like this in a while.  Thank you so much for such a pleasant dinner.  I will look up his name and fill it in later.

Beyond annoyed with the service my friends and I received tonight. Just left your location, we sat in the bar area (6 people) and the service was horrible. Our waitress was rude, ask one couple if they wanted anything and walk away. The rest of the party was trying to get her attention but she would just leave. Next, she not once asked to take the menus off the table and NOT ONCE did she offer to clean our table, I.e. Take the cups and dishes off of our table. Also when we asked her what was on happy hour, she gave us a half as answer and a few of us ordered stuff that wasn't on happy hour. Poor customer service and I DO NOT like to EAT with trash in front of me. See the picture. We felt it would be necessary to take a picture of how ridiculous our trashy table was.

The customer service at this location is just... bad.  That's it, really.  Food's decent, pretty hard to mess up deep fried and overly salted dishes.  But if you're expecting good service, this isn't the place for you.
Got 3 endless appetizers, but the waiter only came once to drop off the food. Terrible service, drinks never came to the table as well. Never coming back.
Always a great go to for happy hour! Good prices on drink and apps. I love the jack Daniel plates here! Plenty of seating at bar area and gets very fun for football season!
Came and they canno accommodate me for my allergies. I asked if they can grill my chicken and they can't promise it won't touch any shell fish. Won't be back...the server was not as friendly either

Food is always delicious , tonight our server was Ashley (we sat in the bar section) she was the best server we've had she was super sweet and personable and she kept our drinks filled she was just on it thanks again Ashley I would definitely sit in your  section again we also talked music with her....lol

Poor Service, food was cold, bathroom was filthy and overall just disgusting.  My husband and I ate dinner there last night, 4/14/2017.  We will NEVER go back.  Hard to believe just how horrible the entire experience was!!!

location: South San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: Came in on a Wednesday for a beer and decided to order some food, but because the kitchen staff was busy I was unable to get it prepared how I wanted. What? Im a paying customer and was told I couldn't get my food how i would be paying for it to be made? Kind of ridiculous. Maybe they need to hire more staff. Will not be back even though ww have family that lives down the street.

Omg!   1. The fish is smaller than half size from what they have pictured in their menu.  2. It says mash-potato... they brought rice... WHY? 3. Spinach salad - on photo it is with mushrooms and onions, and look so good! They brought just plain spinach leaves without anything!!!   I will never come back!  It was just horrible experience! P.S We came with baby and stroller. Workers (those people that gives you table and sits) don't think at all! They give you the most uncomfortable sit where you have no place to put stroller!  We asked twice to change the table, nothing happened!  Zero Stars  to this place!
Wow! Great experience. From the hostess to the late hour food serving to the handsome and charming Alberto we had a terrific time. Way beyond expectations.

When u walk in it starts  very well but quickly goes downhill from there. Bar area great with large bar area and tvs. Drinks good. Service ok. Food horrible. Greasy, cold & tasteless.  Stomach ache & bad gas the rest of the nite is what I remember from this place.

The service here was meh and do was the food. Do not order mixed drinks. Every time that I have been here before the drinks are terrible. The beer is pretty good that's about it. The reason I like coming here is because it's open late.
Horrible service! Hostess told us the wait would be 20-25 minutes and after half an hour, rudely told us it would be an additional half hour. Definitely not coming back!

Sucked!!!!!×10000000 45 min to get meal. Not even warm. Manager was apologetic but not rrslly. Waitress was very sweet and embarrassed said it happens often. Both meals sent back only to cone back out after being over nuked.  Never going back.
Great place to come chill and have conversation a bar for singles and booths for families... basketball football hockey espn its all here...
We were here for Mother's Day dinner..Food was ok ..nothing against it ..but I will say small portion size and expensive..$12.50  for a margarita..I will never go back..:-(

Honestly for the 45 minutes that we waited to get seated, it was not worth it. Waiter messed up the order two times. I ordered a clam chowder, clam chatter came back cold and smelly, it really disturbing smell. I also ordered lobster and steak- stick came back extremely rare, mashed potatoes were the only thing that I enjoyed. Cajun pasta That we ordered also came cold. If you're looking for a place to drink and eat, I really don't recommend this place. Too pricey, and the service and food is not that great.

If you like to waste your hard-earned money on sub-par "bar" food and so-so service, then come to this Friday's (or maybe any Friday's). This is the first, and LAST, time I've been to this Friday's at the Porter Ranch location and I was SO disappointed. Our party of 3 got there around 8:10pm on Saturday night and still had to wait 20 min. for a table (wow, who knew a lot of people like Friday's?!). I haven't had Friday's in a long time (the last one I went to was the one in Woodland Hills over 8 years ago and it was way better than tonight's experience: good-sized portions, good service and decent prices (about $8-$12 for entrees)). Our server was nice but he seemed in a rush for some reason. He was prompt with our drinks (Red's Apple Ale (didn't bring a glass but it's ok, my hubby drank it straight from the bottle; tropical raspberry tea was way too syrupy-tasting and too sweet). Mid-way, he went on his break and another server came to help us (she was prompt with the water refills but after we got our entrees, she never checked back on us!)! We got our entrees in a timely manner, but when I asked for an extra plate (so I can share food with my daughter), she never came back to give me one, so I just ate off of my daughter's plate! Food is overpriced for the amount and quality you get. We started with mozzarella sticks. Six sticks the size of your pointer finger for $10!! Half of them were empty (cheese had oozed out of them) and we were left with only the "shell" breading. So sad. Hubby ordered sizzling chicken and shrimp ($18.50)- two thin, palm-sized chicken breasts grilled with 3-4 small shrimp on a hot plate with melted cheese and a small handful of bell peppers with a side of rice pilaf (probably a cup). The chicken was not dry but it was oily from the melted cheese in the hot plate. I was going to share the parmesan crusted chicken. Chicken was the size of a drink coaster and tougher than the leather on my shoes. It was a strange texture (like it was frozen, defrosted, then pan fried). The crust was not crunchy and was falling apart. The mac n cheese that came with it had not taste to it and the noodles were overcooked (not al dente). The tomato mozzarella salad was a handful of cut-in-half mini tomatoes and mozzarella balls tossed in a barely there oil vinaigrette. It was definitely not worth $14! The best part of the meal was the cold Red's Apple Ale from the bottle! We complained to our server about the food and he took off the mozzerella sticks and the parmesan chicken (which would've been comped anyways because we used a buy one, get one free entree with purchase of two drinks coupon but even with the coupon, the meal was not worth it!)!  This will be the last time I go to any Friday's. Just bummed I spent any amount of money on this really poor dining experience!
